A makeshift command center has been set up in a blasted a ice.  The low-ceilinged room is a beehive of activity. Co troops, and droids move about setting up electronic equip monitoring radar signals. General Rieekan straightens up from a console at Han's ap

No.  He's checking out a meteorite  that hit near him.
(indicates radar  screen)
With all the meteor activity in this system, it's going to be difficult  to spot approaching ships. Taking a deep breath, Han blurts out what is on his mind.

General, I've got to leave.  I  can't stay anymore. Princess Leia, standing at a console nearby, is dressed i white combat jacket and pants.  Her hair is braided acros a Nordic fashion.  She overhears their  conversation and distressed.
I'm sorry to hear that.
Well, there's a price on my head. If I don't pay off Jabba the Hut,  I'm a dead man.
A death mark's not an easy thing  to live with.  You're a good fighter, Solo.  I hate to lose you.
Thank you, General. He turns to Leia as Rieekan moves away.
(with feeling)
Well, Your Highness, I guess this  is it.
That's right. Leia is angry.  Han sees she has no warmth to offer him. head and adopts a sarcastic tone.
(cooly)
Well, don't get all mushy on me. So long, Princess. Han walks away into the quiet corridor adjoining the comm Leia stews a moment, then hurries after him.
Han! Han stops in the corridor and turns to face Leia.
Yes, Your Highnessness?
I thought you decided to stay.
Well, the bounty hunter we ran  into on Ord Mantell changed my mind.
Han, we need you!
We?
Yes.
Oh, what about you need?
(mystified)
I need?  I don't know what you're  talking about.
(shakes his head,  fed up)
You probably don't.
And what precisely am I supposed  to know?
Come on!  You want me to stay  because of the way you feel about me.
Yes.  You're a great help to us. You're a natural leader...
No!  That's not it.  Come on.   Aahhh - uh huh!  Come on. Leia stares at him, understanding, then laughs.
You're imagining things.
Am I?  Then why are you following  me?  Afraid I was going to leave without giving you a goodbye kiss?
I'd just as soon kiss a Wookiee.
I can arrange that.  You could use  a good kiss! Angrily, Han strides down the corridor as Leia stares aft

Don't try to blame me.  I didn't  ask you to turn on the thermal  heater.  I merely commented that it  was freezing in the princess'  chamber.  But it's supposed to be  freezing.  How are we going to dry  out all her clothes?  I really don't  know. Artoo beeps a stream of protesting whistles.
Oh, switch off.
The two robots stop at Han Solo's space freighter.  Han a struggling with their central lifters.
(to Chewie)
Why do you take this apart now?  I'm trying to get us out of here  and you pull both of these. Chewie grumbles in irritation.
Excuse me, sir.
(to Chewie)
Put them back together right now.
Might I have a word with you,  please?
What do you want?
Well, it's Princess Leia, sir. She's been trying to get you on  the communicator.
I turned it off.  I don't want to  talk to her.
Oh.  Well, Princess Leia is wondering  about Master Luke.  He hasn't come  back yet.  She doesn't know where he  is.
I don't know where he is.
Nobody knows where he is.
What do you mean, "nobody knows"? Han glances at the fading light at the entrance of the ic night slowly begins to fall on the planet.
Well, uh, you see... Han jumps down off the lift, as Threepio follows him.
Deck Officer.  Deck Officer!
Excuse me, sir.  Might I inqu... Han abruptly puts his hand over Threepio's mouth as the d approaches.
Yes, sir?
Do you know where Commander  Skywalker is?
I haven't seen him.  It's possible  he came in through the south entrance.
It's possible?  Why don't you go  find out?  It's getting dark out there.
Yes, sir. The deck officer leaves hurriedly, as Han takes his hand mouth.
Excuse me, sir.  Might I inquire  what's going on?
Why not?
Impossible man.  Come along, Artoo,  let's find Princess Leia.  Between  ourselves, I think Master Luke is  in considerable danger.
The deck officer and his assistant hurry toward Han as he tunnel.
Sir, Commander Skywalker hasn't  come in through the south entrance. He might have forgotten to check in.
Not likely.  Are the speeders ready?
Not yet.  We're having some trouble  adapting them to the cold.
Then we'll have to go out on  Tauntauns.
Sir, the temperature's dropping too  rapidly.
That's right.  And my friends out  in it.
I'll cover sector twelve.  Have  com-control set screen alpha. Han pushes through the troops and mounts a Tauntaun.
Your Tauntaun'll freeze before you  reach the first marker.
Then I'll see you in hell! Han maneuvers his mount out of the cave and races into th night.

Stupid little short-circuit.  He'll  be quite all right. Threepio turns to go back inside the main hangar as Artoo keeps his vigil.

The wind is blowing quite strong now.  Luke struggles to but a blast of freezing snow knocks him over.  He struggl but he can't.  The young warrior from Tatooine drags hims of feet and then collapses.
